OCC.DAT:
operation exec throws ; The exec operation of a DSP is fired in the following situations: ; - Explicitly by a web client's URL: "<website>/wrd/MYDSP.exec" ; - Implicitly by a web client's URL: "<website>/wrd/MYDSP", where exec is the default operation if not specified ; - Implicitly by a web client requesting a contained DSP public web ; Your SCOPE block here (optional)... ; Your VARIABLES block here (optional)...
; Your implementation here...
; Return execution status: ; return 0 ; return >= 0 typically indicates a successful execution ; return -1 ; return < 0 typically indicates an error during execution return 0
end
trigger preActivate throws ; The preActivate trigger of a DSP is fired just before the activation of the requested operation or trigger. ; It typically handles: ; - Loading instance specific state ; - Loading the data send received from the web client.
; Load instance state here, e.g.: ; (See libsnp:USCRIPT_DSP/snp:'partner operation stateLoad' for examples on saving/loading state) ; $instancehandle()->stateLoad()
; Load the load data send from the web client into the instance selectcase $webrequesttype case "DYNAMIC" ; Load data as disconnected records into instance ; Use occurrence triggers preDeserialize and postDeserialize to influence loading of the data. webload ; Reconnect data with database and other data already in instance $instancehandle()->reconnect() ; Set active path websetocc endselectcase
; return >= 0 to continue with operation/trigger activation ; return < 0 to reject operation execution, this causes a -71 <UACTERR_GET_STATE> exception return 0
end
partner operation reconnect throws variables string vEntityName boolean vReconnectErrorsFound struct vDataErrors endvariables
; Reconnect disconnected records already loaded in the component instance with database and connected data already in the instance vDataErrors = $newstruct forlist vEntityName in $componentinfo($instancename, "OUTERENTITIES") reconnect vEntityName if ($status > 0) ; Reconnect errors detected, errors are reported by error trigger and added to entity data vReconnectErrorsFound = 1 try ; Add errors to report $collhandle(vEntityName)->reportDataErrors(vDataErrors) catch <UPROCERR_OPERATION> ; Operation to generate error report is not available -> add simple error report vDataErrors->"%%(vEntityName)" = "Reconnect failed" endtry endif endfor ; Return exception with errors if (vReconnectErrorsFound) ; Show errors by throwing exception; further DSP execution is canceled throw -310, "Reconnect failed", ustruct::toList(vDataErrors) endif
end
trigger postActivate throws ; The postActivate trigger of a DSP is fired just after the activation of the requested operation or trigger. ; It typically handles: ; - Generation of a response for the web client ; - Saving any instance specific state. variables string vCookie, vState, vVarList string vEntityName, vEntityProperties endvariables
selectcase $webresponsetype case "UPDATE" ; Instance is already known by web client; only add instance data to web response ; Use occurrence triggers preSerialize and postSerialize to influence saving of the data. websave case "FULLPAGE" ; Instance is not known by web client; add definitions, layout and data to web response ; Add layout to web response, e.g.: ; - from DSP component definition (see Design Layout Worksheet): ; weblayout ; - from external file: ; weblayout "filename.html" ; - from pre-processed DSP component definition (see Design Layout Worksheet): ; vLayout = $instancelayout ; call processLayout(vLayout) ; $instancelayout = vLayout ; weblayout weblayout ; Add component definitions to web response, this includes: ; - component structure ; - default properties ; - default valreps ; - initial values ; Set properties and valreps values here, using: ; putitem/id $properties(MYFIELD.MYENTITY) ; putitem/id $valrep(MYFIELD.MYENTITY) webdefinitions ; Add instance data to web response ; During websave, occurrence triggers preSerialize and postSerialize are fired to influence occurrence serialization. websave endselectcase
; Save instance state here, e.g.: ; (See libsnp:USCRIPT_DSP/snp:'partner operation stateSave' for examples on saving/loading state) ; $instancehandle()->stateSave()
end
